node.title: Turkey’s President Follows His Own Advice Even as Economy Slips
node.description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is increasingly isolated as he clings to an economic prescription that few endorse but that he believes will bear results before elections.

node.title: Texas Cheerleader Makayla Noble Describes Moment She Was Paralyzed
node.description: The high school cheerleader from Prosper said she instantly knew she was paralyzed when she landed on her neck.

node.title: Exclusive: Inside the Security Agencies, Fear of Far Right's Growing Anti-Government Rage
node.description: In this daily series, Newsweek explores the steps that led to the January 6 Capitol Riot.

node.title: Jussie Smollett Verdict: What Happens Next for the 'Mighty Ducks' Actor?
node.description: The former "Empire" actor was found guilty on five counts of disorderly conduct for staging a hate crime against himself back in 2019.

node.title: Mark Meadows PowerPoint Plan to Overturn Election Results Revealed
node.description: Former Trump Chief of Staff Mark Meadows handed over the 38-page document after he was subpoenaed by the House committee investing the January 6 attack.

node.title: December Child Tax Credit Date: Here's When To Expect $1,800 Stimulus Check
node.description: The final payment from the scheme, which was part of the American Rescue Plan, will go out on December 15.

node.title: Al Unser, auto racing legend, has died at 82
node.description: Unser was one of only four drivers to win the Indianapolis 500 a record four times. He'd been battling cancer for 17 years.

node.title: Demaryius Thomas, Ex-Denver Bronco, Is Found Dead
node.description: The 33-year-old had played for the National Football League for 10 seasons and helped lead the Broncos to victory in the Super Bowl in 2016. He retired in June.

node.title: Brian Williams Signs Off MSNBC With Stark Warning About America's Future
node.description: Longtime news anchor Brian Williams concluded his popular nightly MSNBC Show "The 11th Hour."

node.title: A look at the trail of destruction from the ferocious Margaret River bushfire emergency
node.description: A thick layer of ash coats the charred trees inside the fireground, which authorities allowed ABC journalists into.

node.title: Army refused to provide mental health services to former soldier, royal commission told
node.description: A Brisbane mental health unit doctor tried to seek help from the army on behalf of a former soldier, but was knocked back on the grounds the man was no longer on active service, the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide is told.

node.title: Truck loaded with migrants crashes in Mexico, killing dozens
node.description: The migrants were presumably hoping to reach the U.S. Guatemala's top human rights official said there may have been as many as 200 packed into the truck.

node.title: Christmas parties row: Three gatherings to be investigated
node.description: Two Downing Street parties and another at the education department late last year will be examined for Covid-19 rule breaches.

node.title: Truck crash in Mexico kills dozens, injures dozens more
node.description: The victims appeared to be immigrants from Central America, though their nationalities had not yet been confirmed.

node.title: A Candidate Drops Out, Turning the Race for Governor Upside Down
node.description: Letitia James’s surprise decision seemed to solidify the front-runner status of Gov. Kathy Hochul.

node.title: 'He promised he'd come back really fast': Hayez family's agony brings coroner to tears
node.description: Heart-rending statements inside and outside Byron Bay court today as coronial inquest into the Belgian backpacker's disappearance adjourns until next year.

node.title: Omicron Brings New Round of Foreboding for British Businesses
node.description: “None of it’s going to be good,” an economist warns as people are likely to retreat from some aspects of social life as Covid measures tighten.

node.title: What was once one of Europe's largest coal-fired power stations has been demolished in Scotland
node.description: The 183-metre chimney was the largest free-standing structure in Scotland and was considered a regional landmark.

node.title: Co-op adventure about saving broken marriage wins Game of the Year
node.description: It Takes Two has won the top gong at the 2021 Game Awards, a prize that has been previously won by The Last of Us Part II, God of War and The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild.

node.title: Three waters: Govt agreed to mandated strategy before four entities announced
node.description: The government kept councils guessing for months about whether they would be forced into three waters reforms, despite having already agreed to pursue such a strategy, papers show.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 95 new community cases, two further deaths
node.description: There are 95 new cases of Covid-19 in the community today and two further deaths of people with the coronavirus, the Ministry of Health has reported.

node.title: Late Night Is Tired of Tucker Carlson’s ‘Foaming’ at the News
node.description: The Fox News host joined his network in insisting the company’s burned-down Christmas tree is proof of the war on Christmas.

node.title: Fears people are seriously injured following crash between tanker and car
node.description: Emergency services are responding to a crash near Turua, Waikato, and say initial indications are there are serious injuries.

node.title: Summer hotspots may face Covid test result delays - lab expert
node.description: Some small towns around the country may face Covid test result delays this summer if a case causes a surge of testing. Audio

node.title: Former NFL star Demaryius Thomas dead at 33
node.description: He finished his 10-year career as one of the most productive wide receivers of his time, a five-time Pro Bowler and the top pass-catcher for the Denver Broncos' 2015 Super Bowl championship team.

node.title: Former top defense aide, other witnesses appear before Jan. 6 committee
node.description: Stop the Steal organizer Ali Alexander also spoke to the panel for nearly 8 hours.

node.title: Independent Journalism Is at Risk. Here’s How to Save It.
node.description: It will take more than speeches — or indeed Nobel prizes — to save independent journalism.

node.title: '34 seconds of selfish, unprovoked rage' - Matthew Hunt killer sentenced to life in prison
node.description: The man who murdered police officer Matthew Hunt and tried to kill his partner has been jailed for life - with a minimum non parole period of 27 years.

node.title: Child dies following water incident off Napier coast
node.description: A young child has died after getting into difficulty in the sea off Napier.

node.title: Delta flight diverted after passenger allegedly assaults crew member
node.description: The suspect was taken into custody in Oklahoma City after the alleged incident with a flight attendant. The flight was headed to L.A. from Washington, D.C.
